lead_paragraph: When Clifton Dawson was 12, he was playing youth football, and he went on to become the Ivy League’s career leader in rushing yards (4,841) and touchdowns (66). When Cheng Ho was 12, he had come to the United States from Taiwan, he spoke no English and he had never seen a football or heard of the American game.
